main event: The document describes a UFO sighting that occurred on 2 November 1957 at Walker AFB (Roswell, N.M.), with observations from military personnel and control tower technicians.
interesting points: The UFO sighting involved several objects of varying sizes, one of which appeared to be between a B-47 and B-52 in size and had a black color with a reddish blue vapor trail.
The document mentions that the observed object had a very bright light that faded out after about 26 seconds.
Observations included the disappearance of a long and round object similar to large goose feathers, with a light blue trail 2/3 - 3/4 yards long.

The sighting involved multiple locations as burning fueled outlines and running of objects were reported by control personnel at Carlsbad, New Mexico, Hobbs, New Mexico, Wink, Texas, and by the pilot of Continental Airlines Flight 114 near Hobbs, New Mexico.
There were multiple witnesses at different locations, including military personnel, control tower technicians, and the pilot of Continental Airlines Flight 114.
sighted object: several UFOs of varying sizes, one resembling between a B-47 and B-52 in size with a black color and reddish blue vapor trail
witnesses: military personnel, control tower technicians, pilot of Continental Airlines Flight 114
